headline: Salesforce Stock Rises on Earnings. Profits Were the Big Story.
summary: Salesforce  stock reported mixed third-quarter earnings results on Wednesday afternoon.  Adjusted earnings-per-share were $3.25, well ahead of Wall Street’s consensus estimate of $2.86, up from $2.41 last year.  Profitability soared in the third quarter as seen in the earnings beat and in the company’s adjusted operating profit margin of 35.5%, ahead of expectations of 34.1%, and up from 33.1% last year.

raw.headline: Salesforce Stock Rises on Earnings. Profits Were the Big Story.

Profitability soared in the third quarter as seen in the earnings beat and in the company’s adjusted operating profit margin of 35.5%, ahead of expectations of 34.1%, and up from 33.1% last year.

headline: AU10TIX Joins Microsoft Security Store to Advance Secure, Decentralized Identity Verification
summary: AU10TIX, a global leader in identity verification and management, today announced its selection by Microsoft as a premier identity verification (IDV) issuer on the Microsoft Entra platform. This collaboration marks a major milestone in AU10TIX's "Verify Once, Use Everywhere" strategy, bringing its advanced IDV and biometric technology to Microsoft Entra Verified ID to deliver secure, decentralized credentials that strengthen security for over 600 million users worldwide.

headline: Nvidia Stock Drops. What Amazon’s New Chips Mean for the AI Leader.
summary: Nvidia  stock was falling Wednesday, pushed down by the threat of competition from  Amazon.com  new AI hardware.  Nvidia’s competition is Amazon’s new Trainium 3 AI chips, which the e-commerce company launched for customers on Tuesday.  Although Amazon said its chips can reduce the cost of training and operating AI models by up to 50% compared with systems that use equivalent graphics processing units, which are Nvidia’s specialty, the two companies still appear on relatively friendly terms.

raw.headline: Nvidia Stock Drops. What Amazon’s New Chips Mean for the AI Leader.
raw.summary: Nvidia  stock was falling Wednesday, pushed down by the threat of competition from  Amazon.com  new AI hardware.  Nvidia’s competition is Amazon’s new Trainium 3 AI chips, which the e-commerce company launched for customers on Tuesday.  Although Amazon said its chips can reduce the cost of training and operating AI models by up to 50% compared with systems that use equivalent graphics processing units, which are Nvidia’s specialty, the two companies still appear on relatively friendly terms.

headline: AI race's new contenders, ADP reports loss of 32K jobs in November
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman brings you the latest financial and market news for December 3, 2025 Recently, OpenAI's Sam Altman declared a "code red" as the AI competition intensifies. Our panel examines the competition in the AI arms race between OpenAI, Gemini, Nvidia, and Microsoft. Also, Julie speaks with Aadil Zaman, Wall Street Alliance partner, about why he believes Google is leading in AI. Zaman discusses where investors should be exposed, a market pullback, and a shift from AI leaders to enablers. US stocks jumped after a weak ADP report for November, which showed hiring at US companies fell by the most since 2023. Private sector jobs decreased by 32,000 last month. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Salesforce’s Stock Is Historically Cheap as AI Risk Takes a Toll
summary: The maker of customer relationship management software reports earnings after the bell, and has recently pointed to better times ahead, forecasting double-digit revenue growth in the coming years.  “We need a change in sentiment for investors to take a look, and that will be driven by stability and an improvement in topline growth,” said Hilary Frisch, senior research analyst at ClearBridge Investments.  Salesforce’s stock price has been hammered by pessimism all year, plunging 30% in 2025 to make the company the second-worst performer in the Dow Jones Industrial Average and putting it among the 25 worst in the S&P 500 Index.

headline: Microsoft lowers AI software sales quota as customers resist new products, The Information reports
summary: Multiple divisions at Microsoft have lowered sales growth targets for certain artificial intelligence products after many sales staff missed goals in the fiscal year that ended in June, ​The Information reported on Wednesday.  It is rare for Microsoft to lower quotas for specific products, the report ‌said, citing two salespeople in the Azure cloud unit.  The division is closely watched by investors as it is the main beneficiary of ‌Microsoft's AI push.

raw.headline: Microsoft lowers AI software sales quota as customers resist new products, The Information reports
raw.summary: Multiple divisions at Microsoft have lowered sales growth targets for certain artificial intelligence products after many sales staff missed goals in the fiscal year that ended in June, ​The Information reported on Wednesday.  It is rare for Microsoft to lower quotas for specific products, the report ‌said, citing two salespeople in the Azure cloud unit.  The division is closely watched by investors as it is the main beneficiary of ‌Microsoft's AI push.

headline: NTT DATA signs agreement to acquire SPRO, strengthening its capabilities in SAP for agribusiness in Brazil
summary: NTT DATA Business Solutions, a leading global IT service provider focused on SAP, today announced the signing of an agreement to acquire SPRO IT Solutions, a leading SAP provider in the agribusiness industry in Brazil. The terms of the acquisition have been finalized and will be completed following approval from the Administrative Council for Economic Defense (CADE).

headline: Foxconn subsidiary plans to expand production in Vietnam, document shows
summary: Fushan Technology, a subsidiary of Taiwanese electronics manufacturer Foxconn, is seeking ​a permit to expand production in Vietnam ‌to make Xbox gaming devices and other electronic parts, according to ‌a company document sent to Bac Ninh province's environmental department.  Fushan ‌Technology's facility, originally a manufacturing plant for Nokia and Microsoft mobile devices, can also produce up to 100,000 unmanned aerial vehicles, or drones, per year, the document said.  Fushan Technology Vietnam did not immediately respond ⁠to a request for comment.

headline: The AI frenzy is driving a new global supply chain crisis
summary: An acute global shortage of memory chips is forcing artificial intelligence and consumer-electronics companies to fight for dwindling supplies, as prices soar for the unglamorous but essential components that allow devices to store data.  Tech giants including Microsoft, Google and ByteDance are scrambling to secure supplies from memory-chip makers such as Micron, Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix, according to three people familiar with the discussions.

raw.headline: The AI frenzy is driving a new global supply chain crisis

headline: Anthropic plans an IPO as early as 2026, FT reports
summary: Anthropic, the artificial intelligence startup backed by Alphabet's Google and Amazon.com, has hired the law firm Wilson Sonsini to prepare for an initial ​public offering that could take place as early as 2026, the Financial Times ‌reported on Tuesday.  An IPO would give the company, which operates the AI chatbot Claude, a more efficient way to ‌raise capital and provide leverage for bigger acquisitions through public stock.  The company ⁠has previously turned to Wilson Sonsini ‌for a range of corporate matters.
